name: Useful volume
description: Number of merged PRs (excluding repos owned by the user) over the lookback window.
data to fetch from GitHub API: search PRs: is:pr author:{login} merged:>=from repo.owner.login != user.login; fields: createdAt, mergedAt, repository{owner{login}}, number
how to compute the rating from the data: Compute total -> convert to cohort percentile (tech). Rating = 1 + floor(percentile*19).
additional notes: Prefer total count for efficiency; weekly caps require per-PR timestamps.

name: Efficiency (merge rate)
description: Merge rate for PRs opened in the window (excluding user repos).
data to fetch from GitHub API: search PRs: is:pr author:{login} created:>=from repo.owner.login != user.login -is:draft; fields: state, mergedAt
how to compute the rating from the data: merge_rate = merged/opened (opened = all created in window) -> cohort percentile -> 1-20.
additional notes: Ensure merged is computed on the same created>=from cohort.

name: Velocity (p95 time-to-merge)
description: p95 time between createdAt and mergedAt (smaller is better).
data to fetch from GitHub API: search merged PRs: is:pr author:{login} merged:>=from repo.owner.login != user.login; fields: createdAt, mergedAt
additional notes: If no merged PRs in window
column8: rating is null. Clamp to 14 days to avoid extreme durations.

name: Cleanliness (no changes requested)
description: % of merged PRs without CHANGES_REQUESTED reviews (excluding user repos).
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ reviewDecision reviews(states:CHANGES_REQUESTED){totalCount} repository{owner{login}} }
additional notes: Count only reviews before mergedAt.

name: Self-resolved issues
description: Issues you created that are later closed by your PRs.
data to fetch from GitHub API: issue(author:USER) linked to pullRequest(author:USER) via closingIssuesReferences
additional notes: Merged from A5/D4; focuses on end-to-end ownership.

name: External merges
description: % of PRs merged by an external maintainer (not you and not your org).
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ mergedBy{login} repository{ owner{ login } } author{login} } + org membership
additional notes: External = mergedBy != author and mergedBy not in your organization.

name: Reviews given
description: Number of reviews you leave on other people's PRs.
data to fetch from GitHub API: contributionsCollection{ pullRequestReviewContributions{ nodes{ occurredAt pullRequest{ author{login} } }}} (filter author != user)
additional notes: Use log1p to compress if needed before percentile.

name: Reviews received
description: Number of reviews received on your PRs.
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ reviews{ totalCount } } on your PRs
additional notes: Optional if you prefer balance with B4.

name: Review acceptance
description: Share of your reviews followed by a quick merge (<= N days).
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequestReviewContributions{ nodes{ occurredAt pullRequest{ mergedAt }}}
additional notes: Exclude self-review (author != user). N=7 days by default.

name: Author responsiveness
description: p95 time between first review received and your first response (comment/commit).
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ timelineItems(itemTypes:[REVIEWED,ISSUE_COMMENTED,COMMITTED]){ nodes{ ... on PullRequestReview{ createdAt } ... on IssueComment{ createdAt author{login} } ... on Commit{ committedDate author{user{login}} }}}}
additional notes: Filter to your responses (author=you).

name: Review relevance
description: Quality of your review comments (length + presence of code blocks).
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequestReviewContributions{ nodes{ pullRequestReview{ body }}} or comments body
additional notes: N~20 words; detect ``` in body.

name: Active days per week
description: Number of distinct days with >=1 contribution (cap at 5).
data to fetch from GitHub API: contributionsCollection{ contributionCalendar{ weeks{ contributionDays{ date contributionCount }}}}
additional notes: Exclude issues to avoid bot noise. Do not reward 7/7.

name: EMA regularity
description: EMA of active days per week (smoothing alpha~=0.3).
data to fetch from GitHub API: Same data as C1 across successive weeks
additional notes: Window 8-12 weeks.

name: Weekly stability
description: Low variance of volume (PR+reviews+issues) week to week.
data to fetch from GitHub API: Weekly counts of PR/reviews/issues
additional notes: Robust to empty weeks (ignore if variance very low).

name: Recency of activity
description: Heavier weight for recent contributions (decay).
data to fetch from GitHub API: Timestamps of all contributions
how to compute the rating from the data: score = sum exp(-delta_t/tau) over 12 weeks -> percentile -> 1-20.
additional notes: tau~=4 weeks.

name: External engagement
description: Unique non-affiliated commenters on your issues/PRs.
data to fetch from GitHub API: issue/PR comments{ nodes{ author{login} } } + affiliation
additional notes: Measures interest outside your circle.

name: Repo impact
description: Impact of repos where your PRs are merged (stars/forks normalized by age).
data to fetch from GitHub API: repository{ stargazerCount forkCount createdAt }
additional notes: Normalize impact within cohort; age in years

name: Maintainer trust
description: Roles/permissions obtained (triage/collaborator/member) weighted by repo/org impact.
data to fetch from GitHub API: collaborator status, organization membership, repository affiliation
additional notes: Weights: member>collaborator>triage; multiply by normalized repo/org impact.

name: CI pass rate
description: % of SUCCESS checks on your merged PRs.
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ commits(last:1){ nodes{ commit{ statusCheckRollup{ contexts{ nodes{ ... on CheckRun{ conclusion } ... on StatusContext{ state } }}}}}}}
additional notes: Ignore PRs without checks (or neutralize).

name: Tests touched
description: % of test files modified in your PRs.
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ files(first:100){ nodes{ path } } }
additional notes: Pattern: __tests__|\.spec\.|\.test\. Paginate files for large PRs or mark as approximate.

name: PR lead time
description: Time between first commit of the PR and merge (smaller is better).
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ commits(first:1){ nodes{ commit{ committedDate }}} mergedAt }
additional notes: Clamp to 30 days.

name: Security (dependency PRs)
description: Dependency-related PRs (e.g.
data to fetch from GitHub API: dependabot or security label) closed/merged.
additional notes: todo

name: Coverage proxy (tests delta)
description: Test lines added/modified relative to total lines changed.
data to fetch from GitHub API: pullRequest{ additions deletions files{ path additions deletions } }
additional notes: Paginate files for large PRs or mark as approximate if only file-level granularity is available.
